newsitem.title: FRANCE: Bomb blast damages Corsican bank, no injuries.
newsitem.headline: Bomb blast damages Corsican bank, no injuries.

text.p: A bomb exploded at a bank in the town of Ile-Rousse in northern Corsica overnight, causing significant damange but no injuries, gendarmerie para-military police said on Saturday.
It said the device had been placed on an outside cash dispenser of the Banque Populaire Provencale et Corse. The blast wrecked the bank's computers and furniture and shattered its windows.

A few minutes later, gendarmes found a charge of dynamite placed on a cash dispenser outside another bank, the Credit Agricole, in the nearby seaside resort of Balagne, whose mayor is Veterans Affairs Minister Pierre Pasquini. It was defused.
No one claimed responsibility for the two acts, which resembled previous actions carried out as part of a long-running campaign by separatist guerrillas seeking greater autonomy from France.
